main event: Military personnel at the Nicosia Airfield in Cyprus observed a bright, bluish-white, fast-moving unidentified aerial object on August 20, 1950.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be about 1/10 the size of the moon and maintained a constant high speed without leaving a trail.
The object was observed through the open windows of a hangar and was visible for approximately 25 degrees below the zenith.
Several USAF officers, including a Captain, 1st Lt, Maj, and another 1st Lt, also observed the bright, round, fast-moving object over the Nicosia Airfield.
The object appeared suddenly from the northwest, traveled at a terrific speed, and disappeared to the southeast, remaining in view for only a few seconds.
The object's color was described as a brilliant white-blue and its visibility was at least 50 miles.
sighted object: a bright, bluish-white, fast-moving unidentified aerial object
witnesses: military personnel, including a Captain, 1st Lt, Maj, and another 1st Lt
photographs: no, the report does not include any photographs
